posts.title: ForrstKit: An Objective-C Wrapper for the Forrst API
posts.description:
I spent a little bit of time this morning creating a simple Objective-C wrapper for the Forrst API using the JSON-Framework and ASIHTTPRequest. It uses NSNotificationCenter to handle data instead of responding with a specific object type. All current API methods except users/auth are implemented since it's currently disabled, I did include the post/comments methods though they require authentication.

I know there has been mention from some people about building Forrst apps for iOS, so hopefully this is helpful to them and others.
posts.formatted_description:
I spent a little bit of time this morning creating a simple Objective-C wrapper for the Forrst API using the JSON-Framework and ASIHTTPRequest. It uses NSNotificationCenter to handle data instead of responding with a specific object type. All current API methods except users/auth are implemented since it's currently disabled, I did include the post/comments methods though they require authentication.

user.name: Eric Scott
user.bio: I'm early on in my 3rd decade of life. I live with my wonderful wife, Lindsey. We have a bun in the oven and a dog named Tim. I listen to some loud and heavy music, and some ambient and relaxing music. I also have a compulsion to make lists of things I collect, like screenprinted posters, vinyl, comic books, etc. I like jumping off of tall things into water. I used to be in bands and toured a lot, but it's been a while. In general, I enjoy life. I'm constantly finding new hobbies and soaking up knowledge and trivia.

posts.title: who has experience with CorelDRAW?
posts.content: I have a project in the pipeline where the client might need to a plugin to their webstore which utilizes CorelDRAW templating, and I literally know nothing about it. I think that they currently use Photoshop and possibly InDesign. Does anybody have any experience with it, and should I warn the clients about a huge learning curve, or are the principles the same?

posts.title: Random Forrst Post (Python)
posts.description:
Just another way to get a random forrst post using the api, but this time in python.

**Usage:**

     post = randForrstPost()

**Note::**
I am aware this could be made a *one-liner* but I didn't for clarity.
posts.formatted_content: import urllib2, json, random def randForrstPost(): f = urllib2.urlopen("forrst.com/api/v2/posts/…") j = json.loads(f.read()) j = j['resp']['posts'] return random.choice(j)
posts.formatted_description:
Just another way to get a random forrst post using the api, but this time in python.

Usage:

 post = randForrstPost()
Raw

Note:: I am aware this could be made a one-liner but I didn't for clarity.

posts.title: Forrst API wrapper roundup

posts.title: A revised random forrst post function (PHP)
posts.formatted_content: <?php function randForrstPost() { $list = json_decode(file_get_contents("forrst.com/api/v2/posts/…")); $list = $list->resp->posts; $post = $list[array_rand($list)]; return $post; } ?>
posts.formatted_description:
A revised version of my random forrst post script, which uses the amazing new forrst api, high five to the forrst team for that btw. All this does is selects a random post using the api, so you would still need at least some knowledge of the api to make some good from this.

Usage:

$post = randomForrstPost();
Raw

posts.title: I want to work in Canada - Advice?
posts.content:
Hello all,

I'm looking at working in Canada as its always been something i've always wanted to do. Could anyone recommend any design agencies over there that I could get in touch with who maybe looking for web designers?

It would be great to here from any Canadians who know of/work with great design companies. All advice would be brilliant.
